Well Im supposed to be working on an assisgnment but I cant but bothered. Matte rof fact I really dont want to do it. Can you believe it half of the uni semester is nearly passed and I have completed at least 20-30% of my average grade. Woot! But still havent received any of my marks. 

In greater news. I fell over in the middle of Broadway shopping centre and grazed my knee. I now only look like an 8 year old I feel and act like one too. Joel also bought a nintendo wii which means countless hours of computer games especially mario party - my new vice. 

I have taken to drinking mochas not lattes as no one knows how to make a latter. Froth - no more than a 1/3 of the cup not half a cup or none at all  - thats just wrong and poor barista skills. I dream of going to Italy and drinking real coffee and eating carbs. 

Carbs are my friend as Jaime and I have discovered - revered food group of our existence. Cakes are also important in the scheme of things too. Work is going well - I have been working with Jai for the past month and now Im bsck to Mascot, world of bogans, office junkies and ethnic civilisation as it is. No more homosexuals, meterosexuals and art fags. Shucks Im going to miss them ! I seen Rachels friend a few weeks ago - I forget his name but we met once when I was out with Caley and Rachel was at the same venue. Funny that...

Ive been discussing Australian values and normalcy in a few of my lectures and have discovered a new found passion of mine. I love this stuff - the whole identity thing and what is normal. Shame the classes I discuss this in is full of education/business students who really dont get the politics behind all this. 

Funniest thing ever was about 3 weeks ago I had this debate with a girl over the fact you cannot get sodium out of sodium chloride as once its combined you cant separate again and you she told 'uhhh maybe you can?' I replied insistently 'no you cant' then she repeated the question. I said with an angry look no you cant. Long aand behold she was from the education faculty. But isnt that suimple knowledge. Dude you are going to be teaching my children one day and you dont know basic chemistry. PS sodium is a highly reactive metal thats like rubber when its by itself - combined with chlorine and its table salt. You cannot separate a solution...

In other news - Joel and i have been going out for 7 months, its full time and for a long time i think. Long Long  like several years. Its fabulous. 

Anyway must fly - do have uni work to do, 

Nat xo

PS Earthdance is on at Sydney Park near Newtown - looks like a tops festival - gold coin entry, live music and markets. I encourage all you housebodies to go. Jai, Joel and I will be thereand square, drinking chai and eating vegan brownies while the sun shines and the music plays...

During the past few weeks I have felt at my worst - a case of a severe low I just havent been able to shake. IN turn I have caused much worry to my family and immediate friends.

The worse thing is I feel like I cant escape and it just lingers - emerging to make me sad and all alone again. 

My mum and Joel have been great but it feels like they havent helped at all like its only something I can get myslef I out of. 

Uni work has been getting done but with meagre effort and if I have tried I get really anxious and stressed about it. My last major essay I am handing in late because I couldnt afford the stress of getting it done in 3 days. Thus losing 10% but not the last of my sanity.

My relationship with Joel is suffering cos it feels like I need him more and I only get to see him for 3 hours at the most as he works. So I get upset and sometimes angry at him and he gets upset at me cos im not telling him why I feel like this cos I dont have an answer.

I just want to crawl up and sleep but I have my essay to finish.

I feel so alone but I have so many people around me who care about me.

I want this feeling to stop but it wont.

I think its a combination of uni work, the death of someone close, my mum and her worries, my crazy grandad and him harassing me, not seeing Joel as much as i used to, not seeing any of my friends as much especially Punk and not having the money to do as much as I used to.

Meh!

- Been eating out close to every day.

- Joel and I now have pet fighting fish at his house. My fishy is red. His name is Oscar. Joel has a blue one and his name is Tooky.

- My Joel has a job now so I have more time for uni now and our time together now means so much.

- Joel graduated 2 weeks ago and I bought the most amazing dress. So chic! and only $20 so cheap and chic.

- Went to Kyras on Saturday and basically cruised around with everyone. 

- On the way home Jai and I discussed life. Drew several interesting conclusions...

- Seen Sam on Sunday night and caught up. 

Life has been cruisy but life will be chaotic from next week with all my essays, presentations, articles and reports due soon. 

Love
Nat xo

I have had one of the best easter breaks ever despite dealing with evil Greeks at work on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. 

Friday I had Good Friday Lunch at my Nan and Pops with all the family and my Joel. It was really cruisy and after lunch I had to go to work for 4 hours. Saturday I worked for 11 hours which sucked but it flew by. I went out to dinner with Joel and his parents and had Nepalese food which was yummo. Joel and I then went easter shopping at Coles at 10pm which was entertaining to say the least. 

Sunday morning I woke up to Joel as I do most mornings these days and it was beautiful cos I was spending the day with the boy I love and my crazy family. We went to Luna Park with my family. My little cousin who is 6 went on the Wild mouse ie the mini rollercoaster with me 10 times. It was crazy. I conned Joel into going on the ferris wheel despite being scared of heights. My cousin Jess gave Joel a picture of her and my Uncle on the Wild mouse with their finger up. My mum gave Joel a pic of me and my sister on the wild mouse. It was cute. 

All in all it has been a fun few days. Monday I went shopping with Punk to Birkenhead Point I didnt buy much - just a pretty Fleur Wood skirt and some shoes for joel. 

Last night I had dinner with at Joels house and today we slept in to 12.30. It was wonderful. I got up had a shower and Joel came home from the shops with brunch. Unfortunately Joel has left me with his computer while hes downstairs finishing off a gold cuff for a client. 

Tommorrow I have lunch with Jai, Sam and Caley which will be fabulous as I havent seen them in ages. Then its work on Thursday and maybe uni work on Friday or maybe a daytrip to the Blue Mountains with my Joel.

Anyway must do stuff besides idle procratsination. 

Love Nat xo

PS Passover at Joels has been amusing. THe food is healthy but basic in that every meal contains matza - a flat unlevened bread thats like a cracker. Ive stayed away from chicken liver and red horseradish. Tonight bread can be eaten again which is good cos I like bread.

Adelaide was a blast. 

I seen puppet shows, a ventriloquist, a dance/spoken work production (Joels sisters production - so pretty - so contemporary flamenco), comedians, street performers, a puppet made from a garbage bad and the amazing drumming monkeys (a kids show but obsenely funny and Joels fav thing ever, will have to hold a screening of teh DvD Joel bought).

Laughed until my sides hurt at Joels sisters bf. Seen my bf get stoned (which was a little weird, against my anti-drugs thing but in essence was Joel just being cruisy and reliving his days as a highschool student). 

Met Joels dad and step mum. Made a lasting impression on Joels family despite my inate Sydney ability to smile fakely all the time. Generally just got along with everyone I met.

More over Im meeting his sister who is soooo talented. Shes a writer and has her own dance production company *squeels*. I might also be going to his uncles vineyard in the barossa valley. (mmmm wine) Im also going to check out other fringe festival events besides his sisters production. Woot!! for arty business in adelaide.

Booked my tickets tonight which cost me a week and half of my pay for three days and two nights but its just enough time to chill out and get away from the city. As well as spend (more) time with my bf. Luckily my bf can also be my tour guide since he lived in adelaide for most of his life...

It feels as though my friends stay away from me now since I have a bf - I dont know why but meh. Im happy and if they cant accept that then i cant accept making an effort. Its not as if I dont give them the time, Id give them an entire week - I just dont get asked to do anything so I just spend my time with joel. Dont know what to do so Ill just do what im doing until things happen.

Anyway Im further isolating myself from study and homework cos Im so happy. It gets done just not weeks in advance only hours and minutes in advance.

Must fly have a little study to do and joel has been left alone with my parents. Not that they dont get on - they love each other more than anything. He probably thinks ive ran away from him.

love ya

What really sucks is the fact that my body is now programmed to wake up at 7am because of work so today instead of sleeping in and crawling out of bed 45 minutes before mmy bus comes I woke up at 7. That blows cos I went to sleep at 12:30 when Joel left. 

So Im at uni being an uber cool second year looking down upon all them kids that are definately first years cos I just happened to finish school before them I am so better than them. LOL NOT REALLY but Ill tell myself that cos it makes me smile bigger than normal.

I strolled down the street almost dancing to the funky new CD i bought last tuesday Modular's Leave them all behind 2. So indie so electronica so alternative. I brushed this guys hand as i was on the verge of dancing down broadway I mumbled sorry and flashed him this masive grin.

Life couldnt get more perfect. I have a fabulous bf, some form of money, appeal, a blossoming study life, friends that love me, family that love me, a social life and a  sydney existence.

I cant get over how well Joel and I get on. It seems so perfect so idealistic and at times it feels as if we will be together forever and its only been 2 weeks / 2days. Its crazy and it doesnt feel as if this feeling will ever subside. 

Im at uni today for one lecture at 10.30am which sucks big time but then Im going to Joels so Im excited. I have PR homework already which I was going to do last night but Joel came over and shattered any prospects of me doing that. Not that I mind. Im kinda addicted to him just being around. 

Tonight because Joels at Tafe I might go to dinner with jai as wed im at uni for a good 2 hours lol. But yeah I miss my punk. Its not as if im neglecting her because of Joel we just dont see each other as often as we should. 3 times a week isnt much. 

Saturday I have the house to myself and Joel is coming over. We are going to crack open his uncles wine. (His uncle owns a vineyard in the barossa valley which could be bad with jai and i's alcoholic tendencies) So we will most prob drink wine, eat, chat and sleep. In essence avoid mardi gras and the chaos of the city. 

Im considering going to Adelaide fromthe 23rd to the 26th with Joel to meet his sister and some of his family but the flight will cost $300 which is kinda epic since im a uni studnet but I guess we will just wait and see. 

Anyway enough about Joel and my state of happiness. Next entry will be a guarenteed depressing one. :P

Love ya my spock monkeys...

Anyway not much else has happened, 
must pace away the night,

Guess whos had a few fun days?

ME!!!

Thursday was Big Day Out bliss. Grooved to dirty electro, dirty beats and dirty rock with my dirty punk. Seen alot of people we knew which was odd. BDO is so mainstream that everyone goes just for the hell of it which means alot of hardcore fans miss out especially those trashy sluts. WHat Id give to hit them. Seen the odd bands/individuals and avoided the main satge all day due to the sheer crappness of it. 

Friday me and my punk went to Norton St for brunch which was delightful. Splendid chaps. Ate and done a social commentary on the Italian haven of Norton St. Also bought 2 new cds - Pinky Tuscadero and Phoenix. Tres fun!

Saturday was work then the usual going out. Met up with K and all the school crowd. Was kinda boring cos we were at Pah-villion so crap music wise and uber mainstream trashy skank wise. So what was a girl to do but drink. Drunk 8 drinks and was merry. Brad and I danced like indie kids on the dance floor and amused ourselves with moves such as the penguin, wax on wax off and the charlie. 

Changed venues to Star Bar which isnt a step up in venues but a step across just without the indian minority. I pullled up this guy who had the same tshirt as his friend who later turned out to be his brother and got chatting. He was noice.

I talked and talked some more which amused him and made me less bored. We walked all the way from Myer in the city to Darlinghurst. It was a long walk but an enjoyable one. Oddly enough he wasnt into one night stands which was a nice change from all the other guys I have been with. He said he would contact me during the week and we would do something so I guess it sounds promising. 

Today I woke up at 1 after falling asleep at 7am. I read the paper and went shopping with Jai at Eastgardens. I bought 2 new stussy tshirts and some billabong jeans. I know cringeworty but they are so nice and they are dark denim. SO HOT! Bought a mask from Lush to clear skin some more. 

Got home and cleaned out my wardrobe which was invigorating. IT means I have space for more new stuff. Not that I need it. 

This week Im working Mon-Tues at Surry Hills and Wed-Sat at mascot which means im going to have no life but it also means that next week I will be cashed up to the extreme. I might do dinner with Cameron sometime this week other than that no real plans. Will have to go out on Sat nite to cleanse body.

Must dawdle away,

We talked to the Gaffs British spruiker who advised us not to go to the Gaff but go to Havanna we decided against it. 

Jai didnt really want to go to Spectrum. So I couldnt check out hot indie boys. Sigh. Instead we watched gays boys and fake bake chicks strut around on oxford st. Much to my enjoyment. 

Not once did I try and pick up. I just danced and enjoyed myself in an innocent fashion. 

We met up with my mum at the observer and decided to abandon her due to tipsy state. It was innocent fun. Next week we will have to go to spectrum.
